title: Sri Lanka state-run CPC to take up supply offers that meet criteria: Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stater-run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation plans to enter into agreements with some suppliers after evaluating 90 proposals received from, Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera had said.
“Proposals that fulfill financial and technical guidelines to be forwarded next week to enter in to agreements,” Minister Wijesekera said in a twitter.com message on June 04.
Sri Lanka’s state-run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation has experienced payment difficulties amid continued monetary instability following a failed float.

Sri Lanka’s power regulator has not raised prices for close to 7 years and exporter in particular are getting subsidies at the expense of domestic credit and monetary instability. (Colombo/June06/2022)
